item.title: Six Big Bets
item.description: You don‚Äôt get to take unlimited big bets in a single lifetime. You get a small number of windows where risk tolerance, energy, capital, and conviction align. In The Black Swan Nassim Taleb frames this as asymmetric exposure to unlimited upside with limited downside. And startups are one of the clearest modern mechanisms for that kind of asymmetry. But what‚Äôs often missed is that these opportunities are finite. You can‚Äôt swing endlessly. Most of life is spent accumulating the resources‚Äîknowledge, capital, relationships‚Äîthat make the next swing possible. What follows are six moments where those resources briefly line up.

item.title: I Reverse Engineered Claude's Memory System, and Here's What I Found!
item.description: When I reverse-engineered ChatGPT‚Äôs memory system, I found it uses pre-computed summaries injected into every prompt. But Claude‚Äôs approach is different. Through extensive experimentation, I discovered Claude uses on-demand tools and selective retrieval, a fundamentally different architecture. But how does this actually work? And how does it compare to ChatGPT‚Äôs approach? This is the second post in a series where I reverse-engineer the memory systems of popular AI assistants. The first post focused on ChatGPT‚Äôs memory system.
